channel.title: Help With Managing Files
channel.description: Hey I recently got this computer. and yes i've download WinRar and everything fine... my issue is when i go and download a .JAR file it does not register. It will register via .ZIP file and will ask me to extract within WinRaR. Can't extract and just run within, because the .JAR needs whole filee. to make it the complete file.

item.title: Help With Managing Files
item.dc:creator: @SinnerHDJR SinnerHDJR
item.description:
@SinnerHDJR wrote:

[quote=“stCky, post:2, topic:548031”]When installing WinRar there is a checkbox option to associate WinRar with .JAR files, you have checked this.

What you need to do, is right-click a JAR file and select “Open With…” at this point you need to check the “Always open files of this type with x” and locate your javaw.exe(someone may confirm this) file[/quote]

reinstalled and unchecked .jar problem solved. thanks stCky

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Managing Files
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

When installing WinRar there is a checkbox option to associate WinRar with .JAR files, you have checked this.

What you need to do, is right-click a JAR file and select “Open With…” at this point you need to check the “Always open files of this type with x” and locate your javaw.exe(someone may confirm this) file

Read full topic

item.title: Help With Managing Files
item.dc:creator: @SinnerHDJR SinnerHDJR
item.description:
@SinnerHDJR wrote:

Hey I recently got this computer. and yes i’ve download WinRar and everything fine… my issue is when i go and download a .JAR file it does not register.
It will register via .ZIP file and will ask me to extract within WinRaR. Can’t extract and just run within, because the .JAR needs whole filee. to make it the complete file.
